item.title: Gallery
item.description: Below are some examples of analysis carried out with pygplates. Below each image is a link to a jupyter notebook that illustrates the steps involved for each example. Code and source data can be downloaded for you to try each example yourself. Load CSV Data and Reconstruct Reconstruct Features to Birth Time View notebook View notebook Motion Paths Flowlines View notebook View notebook Convergence Velocities - Single Point Convergence Velocities - Along Plate Boundaries View notebook View notebook Reconstructions with GMT Animations View notebook View notebook

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: GPlates is open source software for working with plate tectonic reconstructions pygplates is a python API for GPlates. Basically, a python toolbox for coding plate tectonic analysis. The purpose of this site is to introduce some of the ways that a GPlates python API could be useful to different communities looking at the Earth through deep time
